narrative.narrative: AeBal, or its full name of Aerolas de Baleares and known as Quantum Air for its last few months, was a domestic Spanish carrier based at Madrid with bases and focus cities at Barcelona,Palma de Mallorca and Bilbao. It was in operation from July 5,2000 to January 26,2010. It was a subsidiary of Spanair from the start until January 2009 when it was sold to Proturin, a Spanish investment company. They turned it into Quantam Air which lasted only until January 2010. Overall it was owned 51% by Spanair and 49% by Spanair's parent SAS. Spanair itself ceased in January 2012. From Madrid it served Palma de Mallorca,and four in the Canary Islands at Tenerife North, Gran Canaria,Fuerteventura and Lanzarote. The same were served from Barcelona and from Bilbao only Fuerteventura was not served. It also served from Madrid, Jerez and A Coruna. And from Barcelona it did A Coruna,Ibiza,and Asturias. Its initial fleet was three Boeing 717-200's, in 2001 it got another and in 2007 it got another, still having all 5 at the end of its Spanair life, all left following the sell off, Blue1 acquired them.
